info.name: Cirque de la Cascade
info.attribution:
Game layout, design, and scripting by Andy Pymont and released to the Public Domain by CC0.

Tile graphics are from https://game-icons.net/ and are used under the CC BY 3.0 license:

Delapouite
• Blue city / Tightrope icon: https://game-icons.net/1x1/delapouite/tightrope.html
• Meeple icon on Farm tiles: https://game-icons.net/1x1/delapouite/meeple.html
• Orange city / Strongman icon: https://game-icons.net/1x1/delapouite/strong-man.html
• Purple city / Jumping Dog icon: https://game-icons.net/1x1/delapouite/jumping-dog.html
• Seal icon: https://game-icons.net/1x1/delapouite/juggling-seal.html
• Tent icon: https://game-icons.net/1x1/delapouite/medieval-pavilion.html
• Track progress / Fleur de Lys icon: https://game-icons.net/1x1/delapouite/fleur-de-lys.html
• White city / Magic Trick icon: https://game-icons.net/1x1/delapouite/magick-trick.html
• Achievement / Trophy icon: https://game-icons.net/1x1/lorc/trophy.html
• Yellow city / Juggler icon: https://game-icons.net/1x1/lorc/juggler.html

The library image was generated using the Midjourney artificial intelligence image generator, https://www.midjourney.com/home/, using the following prompt: "A circus master juggles in front of a red and yellow tent in a forest clearing".
info.description: Cascade and combo your way to running the greatest circus of them all!
info.ruleText:
PREMISE
Assemble the greatest circus by managing your recruitment of all five types of performer and beating your competitors to a series of awards. Your circus has a strong historical association with one particular type of performer, so make sure that your circus lives up to its reputation or you'll be disqualified from winning the game!

OBJECTIVE
Have the most points when the game end is triggered. Each player is also associated with one of the four non-white colored tracks on the right hand side of the board, and a player cannot win unless they have reached the top of their own track.

The game end will be triggered when either one player has reached 50 or more points at the end of their turn, or when a player begins a turn and has no remaining tent pieces to place.

PLAYER TURNS
On your turn, place one tent piece on the board. If you own one or more seals, you may place this along with your tent in the same space. Either way, your placement may cause cities to be scored and other actions to take place, after which play continues with the next player around the table.

PLACING A TENT
A tent may be placed on any unoccupied, plains (green non-city) hex on the board.

SCORING CITIES
If the tent you place during your turn forms part of a group of 2 or more tents of your color connected contiguously, and this tent is the first of that group to be placed next to a particular city, then that city is scored.

If you place a seal with a tent, then this tent counts as a group even if it is not connected to one or more other tents of your color.

Scoring a city entitles you to move your cube up the track with the same icon and color on the right hand side of the board.

ADVANCING ON THE TRACKS
If the tent placed is the first tent next to the city being scored, the player advances one space on the matching track. If it is not the first tent (of any player) but does meet the requirements for scoring, then the player instead moves two spaces on the matching track. In both cases, if there is a circus scout (white meeple) present in the city, then advance one additional space, i.e two or three spaces in total.

ADVANCEMENT REWARDS
Whenever you advance to or beyond a lighter, non-shaded space on a track, you receive the corresponding reward. The rewards for the blue tightrope artist, yellow juggler, orange strongman, and purple animal trainer tracks are the same at each level and are shown to the left of the tracks; the rewards for the white magician track are different and are shown to the right of the tracks.

To receive the reward for a darker, shaded space, you must advance exactly to this space, i.e. these rewards, unlike the others, are not awarded if you pass through and beyond them during a city scoring.

The spaces marked with an X which break up the tracks are still spaces and you must count them when advancing. However, you may not move into these spaces except as part of a scoring that moves you beyond them - if you gain a single move and are in the space before an X, then you do not advance your cube.

If there are two rewards listed with a forwardslash "/" between them, then the reward to the left of the slash is given to the first player to reach this level of the track and the reward to the right is given to any subsequent players to do so.

DETAILS OF THE REWARDS
Gain the rewards in order from lower on the track to higher, with the exception of extra turns, which you take at the conclusion of this turn.

• Numbers indicate points, which are scored immediately.
• A cube with an upwards arrow indicates that you immediately advance your cube on any one track by one space, gaining the reward as usual.
• The tent with a plus symbol indicates that you take an additional turn at the conclusion of this turn.
• The seal icon means that you collect the seal from this track and place it in your player area. You may place this alongside your tent on any future turn as discussed above.
• The tent with a right arrow icon allows you to move one of your tent pieces on the board to an unoccupied space directly adjacent to it. Unlike placing a new tent, moving a tent in this way does not trigger city scoring.

AWARDS
In the middle section of the board are a series of awards which any player may claim at any point when they have achieved it. Place one of your trophy markers next to the corresponding award and receive the number of points indicated.

EXCLUSIVE AWARDS
The white awards at the top of the awards column are exclusive awards which are claimed by the first player to achieve them. Once claimed, no other player may claim them. The claiming player receives 3 points.

• 5 x 1 Fleur: Have all 5 of your cubes at the 1-Fleur level of the tracks (4 advances from the start).
• 3 x 2 Fleur: Have 3 different cubes at the 2-Fleur level of the tracks (10 advances from the start).
• 1 x 3 Fleur: Have 1 cube at the 3-Fleur level of a track (the top space, 15 advances from the start).
• 3 Seals: Have 3 seals in your player area (i.e. do not count those placed on the board).
• Connect 5 ≠: Have a group of your connected tents which is adjacent to 5 different cities, i.e. one of each color.
• Connect 3 =: Have a group of your connected tents which is adjacent to 3 cities of the same color.

NON-EXCLUSIVE AWARDS
The green award section contains awards which are not exclusive, but instead each player can claim each non-exclusive award once per game.

The first five awards in this section each require having a group of your connected tents which is adjacent to 2 cities of the same, corresponding color and awards 2 points.

The sixth and final award is given for having achieved the five other non-exclusive (green section) awards and awards 10 points.

VARIANT: MOVING SCOUTS
Play with only two scouts instead of four. They begin on the two white cities in the horizontal centre of the board. Any time when a city containing a scout is scored, moved the scout to another city which:
• Is within 3 hexes of the city that was scored;
• Does not already contain a scout; and
• Is not fully surrounded by tent pieces.

VARIANT: ALTERNATIVE BOARD
The alternative board shows farms (randomly distributed each game among spaces between cities) where your circus can resupply and engage with the community. In order to place a tent piece in a farm space you must already have a tent piece in an adjacent hex.

When placing on the farm hex, you immediately gain the corresponding reward:
• 2: Gain 2 points
• 3: Gain 3 points
• Cube with upwards arrow: Advance your cube on any one track, gaining rewards as usual.
• Plus Tent: Take another turn immediately after the conclusion of this turn.
• Circus Scout Meeple: Move one of the circus scouts to any other city on the board that does not already have a scout and is not fully surrounded by tent pieces.

You may move a tent piece onto an adjacent farm with the Move a Tent track reward and in this case you do immmediately gain the benefit of the farm.
info.helpText: Have all players take a seat and then press the New Game button and select the setup which you would like to use.

fields.label: Which circus scout (white meeple) setup should be used?

fields.text: NB: The alternative board cannot be combined with 2 moving Scouts; if this combination is selected, then a random 4 Scout configuration (★/⏺/✖) will be used instead.
